title: President Trump booed loudly at Nationals Park during World Series Game 5
text:
As expected, President Donald Trump attended Game 5 of the World Series between the Astros and Nationals in Washington, D.C. He was flanked by First Lady Melania Trump and the Secret Service, as well as a rather long guest list including Steve Scalise (R-LA), Matt Gaetz (R-FL), and Lindsey Graham (R-SC). Trump’s initial entrance into the ballpark was barely noticed, as Jennifer Jacobs of Bloomberg News noted.

Trump was shown on the Jumbotron at Nationals Park before the start of the top of the fourth inning. He was very loudly booed. Some fans then started a “Lock him up!” chant, as the Washington Post’s Barry Svrluga observed.

Scroll to continue with content Ad

President Donald Trump was just introduced at Nationals Park during Game 5 of the World Series. Lots of boos. pic.twitter.com/xSvZJcTpYH — Chase Hughes (@ChaseHughesNBCS) October 28, 2019
description: President Trump received a chorus of boos when he was shown on the Jumbotron at Nationals Park during Game 5 of the World Series.
